The game is really fun,i remember when i was a kid i used to play Half-life and the Half-life 2 games,when i was a kid i didn't play only for the achievement,i played because it was really cool and i reccomend to play the game!

For everyone saying that this game is good if you have your nostalgia goggles on, I never played these games when I was younger and this was my first play through. People say the guns are boring, but thats not the point, you are meant to use the games amazing physics to your advantage and everyone says the enemys do nothing but run at you, its reminds me of a gaunlet style enemy placement, where their all in positons were you have to actually plan out what your going to do instead of just shooting. The story is very engaging, and while I do think it slows down the games pace a bit, its supplemented by it not being a cutscene so you can actually do stuff, which usally led me into doing weird shit. The climax is a bit abbrupt and it dosen't help thats a cliffhanger eather. But all in all a great game (insert half life 3 joke that isn't funny the 500th time)
Is so cool cuz gorden kills the big bugs and hunter peoples and gets rid of the nether portal, but sad because of what happin at the end. 8/10 is too sad but is still awsum
Funny how the last words spoken in the last Half-Life game for 13 years were "Don't leave me."

The first time I played, the ending shocked me. Hands down best game franchise of all time. If you plan to play this, please do so without spoilers.

The first ever half life game I've ever played.

Just as good as the games that preceded it. If you don't know why we want Half-Life 3 so bad, please play this game from start to finish, preferrably without seeing spoilers.

And before i forget, rest in peace, Robert Guillaume. We miss you.
still makes me tear up when dark interval starts

If you're playing this game for the sake of playing the hyped, legendary, classic Half-life; you might want to lower your expectations. 
I didn't enjoy the first one. Second entry was better visually and introduced a gravity gun, which gave the false sense of a 'good game'. 
Did not enjoy. I think what annoyed me the most was the false fps. The AI is not aiming towards you and shooting, it's just tracking you and shooting with a certain time pattern. If you come out of your cover, they don't give you time to adjust their aim, their crosshair is already on you and you will get blasted for half of your health. Jiggle peeking does not work. 

The plot? I think I'm too dumb to understand or I was so frustrated that I didn't get invested. 
Portal franchize aged way better.
